name: bigquery
recipe:
source:
    type: bigquery
    config:
        include_table_lineage: true
        include_usage_statistics: true
        include_tables: true
        include_views: true
        profiling:
            enabled: true
            profile_table_level_only: true
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true

name: redshift
recipe:
source: 
    type: redshift
    config:
        # Coordinates
        host_port: # Your Redshift host and post, e.g. example.something.us-west-2.redshift.amazonaws.com:5439
        database: # Your Redshift database, e.g. SampleDatabase

        # Credentials
        # Add secret in Secrets Tab with relevant names for each variable
        username: null # Your Redshift username, e.g. admin

        table_lineage_mode: stl_scan_based
        include_table_lineage: true
        include_tables: true
        include_views: true
        profiling:
            enabled: true
            profile_table_level_only: true
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true

name: snowflake
recipe:
source: 
    type: snowflake
    config:
        account_id: null
        include_table_lineage: true
        include_view_lineage: true
        include_tables: true
        include_views: true
        profiling:
            enabled: true
            profile_table_level_only: true
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true

name: kafka
recipe:
source:
    type: kafka
    config:
        connection:
            consumer_config:
                security.protocol: "PLAINTEXT"
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: false

name: looker
recipe:
source:
    type: looker
    config:
        # Coordinates
        base_url: # Your Looker instance URL, e.g. https://company.looker.com:19999

        # Credentials
        # Add secret in Secrets Tab with relevant names for each variable
        client_id: null # Your Looker client id, e.g. admin
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true

name: lookml
recipe:
source:
    type: lookml
    config:
        parse_table_names_from_sql: true
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true

name: tableau
recipe:
source:
    type: tableau
    config:
        # Coordinates
        connect_uri: null
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true

name: powerbi
recipe:
source:
  type: "powerbi"
  config:
    # Your Power BI tenant identifier
    tenant_id: null
    # Your Power BI client id
    client_id: null
    # Your Power BI client secret
    client_secret: null
    stateful_ingestion:
        enabled: true

name: dbt-cloud
recipe:
source:
  type: dbt-cloud
  config:
    account_id: null
    project_id: null
    job_id: null
    target_platform: null
    stateful_ingestion:
      enabled: true

name: mysql
recipe:
source: 
    type: mysql
    config: 
        # Coordinates
        host_port: # Your MySQL host and post, e.g. mysql:3306
        database: # Your MySQL database name, e.g. datahub
    
        # Credentials
        # Add secret in Secrets Tab with relevant names for each variable
        username: null # Your MySQL username, e.g. admin

        # Options
        include_tables: true
        include_views: true

        # Profiling
        profiling:
            enabled: true
            profile_table_level_only: true
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true

name: postgres
recipe:
source: 
    type: postgres
    config:
        # Coordinates
        host_port: # Your Postgres host and port, e.g. postgres:5432
        database: # Your Postgres Database, e.g. sample_db

        # Credentials
        # Add secret in Secrets Tab with relevant names for each variable
        username: null # Your Postgres username, e.g. admin

        # Options
        include_tables: true
        include_views: true

        # Profiling
        profiling:
            enabled: true
            profile_table_level_only: true
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true

name: hive
recipe:
source: 
    type: hive
    config:
        # Coordinates
        host_port: # Your Hive host and port, e.g. hive:10000
        database: # Your Hive database name, e.g. SampleDatabase (Optional, if not specified, ingests from all databases)

        # Credentials
        # Add secret in Secrets Tab with relevant names for each variable
        username: null # Your Hive username, e.g. admin
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true

name: presto
recipe:
source:
    type: presto
    config:
        # Coordinates
        host_port: null
        # The name of the catalog from getting the usage
        database: null
        # Credentials
        username: null
        include_views: true
        include_tables: true
        profiling:
            enabled: true
            profile_table_level_only: true
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true

name: trino
recipe:
source:
    type: trino
    config:
        # Coordinates
        host_port: null
        # The name of the catalog from getting the usage
        database: null
        # Credentials
        username: null
        include_views: true
        include_tables: true
        profiling:
            enabled: true
            profile_table_level_only: true
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true

name: mssql
recipe:
source:
    type: mssql
    config:
        # Coordinates
        host_port: null
        # The name
        database: null
        # Credentials
        username: null
        include_views: true
        include_tables: true
        profiling:
            enabled: true
            profile_table_level_only: true
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true

name: mariadb
recipe:
source:
    type: mariadb
    config:
        # Coordinates
        host_port: null
        # The name
        database: null
        # Credentials
        username: null
        include_views: true
        include_tables: true
        profiling:
            enabled: true
            profile_table_level_only: true
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true

name: unity-catalog
recipe:
source:
    type: unity-catalog
    config:
        # Coordinates
        workspace_url: null
        include_table_lineage: true
        include_column_lineage: false
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true

name: mongodb
recipe:
source:
    type: mongodb
    config:
        # Coordinates
        connect_uri: # Your MongoDB connect URI, e.g. "mongodb://localhost"

        # Credentials
        # Add secret in Secrets Tab with relevant names for each variable
        username: "${MONGO_USERNAME}" # Your MongoDB username, e.g. admin
        password: "${MONGO_PASSWORD}" # Your MongoDB password, e.g. password_01

        # Options (recommended)
        enableSchemaInference: True
        useRandomSampling: True
        maxSchemaSize: 300

name: dynamodb
recipe:
source:
    type: dynamodb
    config:
        platform_instance: "AWS_ACCOUNT_ID"
        aws_access_key_id : '${AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID}'
        aws_secret_access_key : '${AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY}'
        # If there are items that have most representative fields of the table, users could use the
        # `include_table_item` option to provide a list of primary keys of the table in dynamodb format.
        # For each `region.table`, the list of primary keys can be at most 100.
        # We include these items in addition to the first 100 items in the table when we scan it.
        # include_table_item:
        #   region.table_name:
        #     [
        #       {
        #         'partition_key_name': { 'attribute_type': 'attribute_value' },
        #         'sort_key_name': { 'attribute_type': 'attribute_value' },
        #       },
        #     ]

name: glue
recipe:
source:
    type: glue
    config:
        # AWS credentials. 
        aws_region: # The region for your AWS Glue instance. 
        # Add secret in Secrets Tab with relevant names for each variable
        # The access key for your AWS account.
        aws_access_key_id: "${AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID}"
        # The secret key for your AWS account.
        aws_secret_access_key: "${AWS_SECRET_KEY}"
        aws_session_token: # The session key for your AWS account. This is only needed when you are using temporary credentials.
        # aws_role: # (Optional) The role to assume (Role chaining supported by using a sorted list).

        # Allow / Deny specific databases & tables
        # database_pattern:
        #    allow:
        #        - "flights-database"
        # table_pattern:
        #    allow:
        #        - "avro"

name: oracle
recipe:
source: 
    type: oracle
    config:
        # Coordinates
        host_port: # Your Oracle host and port, e.g. oracle:5432
        database: # Your Oracle database name, e.g. sample_db

        # Credentials
        # Add secret in Secrets Tab with relevant names for each variable
        username: "${ORACLE_USERNAME}" # Your Oracle username, e.g. admin
        password: "${ORACLE_PASSWORD}" # Your Oracle password, e.g. password_01

        # Optional service name
        # service_name: # Your service name, e.g. svc # omit database if using this option

name: superset
recipe:
source:
  type: superset
  config:
    # Coordinates
    connect_uri: http://localhost:8088

    # Credentials
    username: user
    password: pass
    provider: ldap

name: athena
recipe:
source:
  type: athena
  config:
    # Coordinates
    aws_region: my_aws_region
    work_group: primary

    # Options
    s3_staging_dir: "s3://my_staging_athena_results_bucket/results/"

name: clickhouse
recipe:
source:
  type: clickhouse
  config:
    # Coordinates
    host_port: localhost:9000

    # Credentials
    username: user
    password: pass

    # Options
    platform_instance: DatabaseNameToBeIngested

    include_views: true # whether to include views, defaults to True
    include_tables: true # whether to include views, defaults to True

sink:
  # sink configs

#---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# For the HTTP interface:
#---------------------------------------------------------------------------
source:
  type: clickhouse
  config:
    host_port: localhost:8443
    protocol: https

#---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# For the Native interface:
#---------------------------------------------------------------------------

source:
  type: clickhouse
  config:
    host_port: localhost:9440
    scheme: clickhouse+native
    secure: True

name: druid
recipe:
source:
  type: druid
  config:
    # Coordinates
    host_port: "localhost:8082"

    # Credentials
    username: admin
    password: password

name: metabase
recipe:
source:
  type: metabase
  config:
    # Coordinates
    connect_uri:

    # Credentials
    username: root
    password: example

name: mlflow
recipe:
source:
  type: mlflow
  config:
    tracking_uri: tracking_uri

name: mode
recipe:
source:
  type: mode
  config:
    # Coordinates
    connect_uri: http://app.mode.com

    # Credentials
    token: token
    password: pass

    # Options
    workspace: "datahub"
    default_schema: "public"
    owner_username_instead_of_email: False
    api_options:
      retry_backoff_multiplier: 2
      max_retry_interval: 10
      max_attempts: 5

name: azure-ad
recipe:
source:
    type: azure-ad
    config:
        client_id: # Your Azure Client ID, e.g. "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
        tenant_id: # Your Azure Tenant ID, e.g. "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
        # Add secret in Secrets Tab with this name
        client_secret: 
        redirect: # Your Redirect URL, e.g. "https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/oauth2/nativeclient"
        authority: # Your Authority URL, e.g. "https://login.microsoftonline.com/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
        token_url: # Your Token URL, e.g. "https://login.microsoftonline.com/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/oauth2/token"
        graph_url: # The Graph URL, e.g. "https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0"
        
        # Optional flags to ingest users, groups, or both
        ingest_users: True
        ingest_groups: True
        
        # Optional Allow / Deny extraction of particular Groups
        # groups_pattern:
        #    allow:
        #        - ".*"

        # Optional Allow / Deny extraction of particular Users.
        # users_pattern:
        #    allow:
        #        - ".*"

name: okta
recipe:
source:
    type: okta
    config:
        # Coordinates
        okta_domain: # Your Okta Domain, e.g. "dev-35531955.okta.com"

        # Credentials
        # Add secret in Secrets Tab with relevant names for each variable
        okta_api_token:  # Your Okta API Token, e.g. "11be4R_M2MzDqXawbTHfKGpKee0kuEOfX1RCQSRx99"

        # Optional flags to ingest users, groups, or both
        ingest_users: True
        ingest_groups: True

        # Optional: Customize the mapping to DataHub Username from an attribute appearing in the Okta User
        # profile. Reference: https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/users/
        # okta_profile_to_username_attr: str = "login"
        # okta_profile_to_username_regex: str = "([^@]+)"
    
        # Optional: Customize the mapping to DataHub Group from an attribute appearing in the Okta Group
        # profile. Reference: https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/groups/
        # okta_profile_to_group_name_attr: str = "name"
        # okta_profile_to_group_name_regex: str = "(.*)"
        
        # Optional: Include deprovisioned or suspended Okta users in the ingestion.
        # include_deprovisioned_users = False
        # include_suspended_users = False

name: vertica
recipe:
source:
    type: vertica
    config:
        # Coordinates
        host_port: localhost:5433
        # The name of the vertica database
        database: Database_Name
        # Credentials
        username: Vertica_User
        password: Vertica_Password

        include_tables: true
        include_views: true
        include_projections: true
        include_models: true
        include_view_lineage: true
        include_projection_lineage: true
        profiling:
            enabled: false
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true

name: fivetran
recipe:
source:
    type: fivetran
    config:
        # Fivetran log connector destination server configurations
        fivetran_log_config:
            destination_platform: snowflake
            snowflake_destination_config:
                # Coordinates
                account_id: snowflake_account_id
                warehouse: warehouse_name
                database: snowflake_db
                log_schema: fivetran_log_schema

                # Credentials
                username: ${SNOWFLAKE_USER}
                password: ${SNOWFLAKE_PASS}
                role: snowflake_role

        # Optional - filter for certain connector names instead of ingesting everything.
        # connector_patterns:
        #     allow:
        #         - connector_name

        # Optional -- This mapping is optional and only required to configure platform-instance for source
        # A mapping of Fivetran connector id to data platform instance
        # sources_to_platform_instance:
        #     calendar_elected:
        #         platform_instance: cloud_postgres_instance
        #         env: DEV

        # Optional -- This mapping is optional and only required to configure platform-instance for destination.
        # A mapping of Fivetran destination id to data platform instance
        # destination_to_platform_instance:
        #     calendar_elected:
        #         platform_instance: cloud_postgres_instance
        #         env: DEV

name: csv-enricher
recipe:
source: 
    type: csv-enricher 
    config: 
        # URL of your csv file to ingest 
        filename: 
        array_delimiter: '|' 
        delimiter: ',' 
        write_semantics: PATCH

name: custom
recipe:
source:
  type: <source-type>
  config:
    # Source-type specifics config
    <source-configs>

name: qlik-sense
recipe:
source:
    type: qlik-sense
    config:
        # Coordinates
        tenant_hostname: https://xyz12xz.us.qlikcloud.com
        # Coordinates
        api_key: QLIK_API_KEY

        # Optional - filter for certain space names instead of ingesting everything.
        # space_pattern:

        #   allow:
        #     - space_name
        ingest_owner: true

name: sigma
recipe:
source:
    type: sigma
    config:
        # Coordinates
        api_url: https://aws-api.sigmacomputing.com/v2
        # Coordinates
        client_id: CLIENT_ID
        client_secret: CLIENT_SECRET

        # Optional - filter for certain workspace names instead of ingesting everything.
        # workspace_pattern:

        #   allow:
        #     - workspace_name
        ingest_owner: true

name: cockroachdb
recipe:
source: 
    type: cockroachdb
    config:
        # Coordinates
        host_port: # Your CockroachDb host and port, e.g. cockroachdb:5432
        database: # Your CockroachDb Database, e.g. sample_db

        # Credentials
        # Add secret in Secrets Tab with relevant names for each variable
        username: null # Your CockroachDb username, e.g. admin

        # Options
        include_tables: true
        include_views: true

        # Profiling
        profiling:
            enabled: true
            profile_table_level_only: true
        stateful_ingestion:
            enabled: true
